business.headline: India-US trade deal nearing first-phase closure as tariff talks progress: ReportIndia and the US are negotiating a bilateral trade agreement. So far, six rounds of talks have been completed. Both sides have announced plans to finalise the first tranche of the deal by fall of 2025.

The hidden risk in 'diversified' portfolios: Expert explainsThe idea that "more products mean more safety" is common among investors, but it can be misleading. An expert's recent client case shows why portfolios that look balanced may still be exposed to the same underlying risk.

Ever heard of Birkin Bag Hedge Fund? Check the details hereBy focusing on colours and styles that sell the fastest, the fund aims to keep its turnover high and returns steady. Its strategy also reflects how the luxury resale market has matured into a serious business, where handbags are now viewed as long-term investment assets.
Sensex ends 388 points higher, Nifty above 26,000; Eternal gains 2%The S&P BSE Sensex gained 388.17 points to close at 84,950.95, while the NSE Nifty50 added 103.40 points to end at 26,013.45.

Who is Groww founder Lalit Keshre, who just turned billionaire after IPO?Groww, which started in 2016 as a simple idea to make investing easy for young Indians, is now one of the country's most valuable fintech firms.

Anil Ambani offers to give virtual statement in money laundering caseReliance Group chairman Anil Ambani has offered to give his statement through video conference to the Enforcement Directorate, following his absence twice in a FEMA probe related to a 2010 highway project.

US dumps the penny, but some of them can still earn you $5 millionThe US Mint officially ended production of the one-cent coin on November 12. US Treasurer Brandon Beach struck the last penny at the Philadelphia Mint, marking the end of the 232-year-old coin that first entered circulation in 1793.

Is India becoming the world's next big consumption powerhouse?While many economies struggle with sluggish demand, India is quietly powering ahead. A booming middle class, strong domestic spending, and favourable demographics are transforming the country into a consumption force that global brands can no longer ignore.

Why has Bitcoin fallen to $93,000 after touching $126,000 in October?The cryptocurrency has now lost more than 10% in the past week, marking its third straight weekly decline. Bitcoin, along with Ethereum, XRP, Cardano, Solana and other major altcoins witnessed a decline in their prices.

Is your Digital Life Certificate rejected? Here's how you can fix itMany pensioners use the Digital Life Certificate to complete their yearly verification from home, but rejections are still common. If your certificate has been turned down, here's a simple look at why it happens and how you can sort it out.
Explained: Why Tata Motors PV shares crashed 6% todayJLR suffered a major setback in Q2, prompting the company to slash its full-year EBIT margin guidance to 0–2% from the earlier 5–7%.

Which cities are seeing a rise in office spaces, and whyIndia's economic story — steady growth, stable demand, and improving infrastructure — is not only creating demand for office spaces but also enabling developers to capitalise on real estate opportunities.

India to source 10% of annual LPG imports from US under first-ever dealThe contract is India's first-ever structured LPG purchase agreement with the US, and is benchmarked to Mont Belvieu, the key US pricing hub for LPG.

Fujiyama Power Systems IPO Day 3: Check latest GMP, subscription status and moreThe IPO, priced between Rs 216 and Rs 228 per share, aims to raise Rs 828 crore. This includes a fresh issue of Rs 600 crore and an offer for sale worth Rs 228 crore by promoters Yogesh Dua and Pawan Kumar Garg.

Capillary Technologies IPO Day 2: Check latest GMP and should you apply?Capillary Technologies' IPO has opened to a cautious start with weak early subscription and a cooling GMP, but long-term brokerage views remain positive, making investors weigh short-term sentiment against long-term potential.

Why buying health insurance should be your first move in personal financeHealth insurance is often treated as an afterthought, yet a single medical emergency can undo years of savings. With rising healthcare costs, early coverage has become the most essential starting point in personal finance.

Sensex, Nifty open in green as earnings optimism lifts sentimentAt around 9:18 am, the S&P BSE Sensex was up 87.27 points at 84,650.05, while the NSE Nifty50 rose 24.50 points to 25,934.55. Broader market indices were mixed in early trade.

Tenneco Clean Air IPO allotment today: Check status, GMP, and listing detailsInvestors can check their allotment status using either the BSE website or the MUFG Intime India portal. The IPO saw heavy bidding across categories. Overall, it was subscribed 61.79 times.

Trump invests at least $82m in bonds, including sectors boosted by his own policiesDonald Trump purchased over $82 million in corporate and municipal bonds from late August to early October. These investments include sectors benefiting from his administration's policies, raising questions about potential conflicts of interest.

Millennials vs Gen Z: How their crypto portfolios and risk appetites differMillennials and Gen Z are both active in the world of crypto, yet they approach it from very different angles. Their portfolios, strategies and risk appetite reveal how differently each generation views money, technology and long-term investing.

entertainment.headline: After The Girlfriend, Dheekshith Shetty leads heist film Bank of Bhagyalakshmi Dheekshith Shetty returns to Kannada cinema with the comedy heist film 'Bank of Bhagyalakshmi'. The trailer promises a unique blend of humour and thrills, releasing in theatres on November 21.

Aishwarya Sharma denies allegations of misconduct: People use my name for views Amid divorce rumours with Neil Bhatt, Aishwarya Sharma has responded to online speculation and negative commentary about her personal life. She addressed false narratives and emphasised her professionalism in an Instagram story.

Court rejects petition seeking name change of Farhan Akhtar's 120 Bahadur The Punjab and Haryana High Court refused to entertain a plea seeking to change the title of Farhan Akhtar's upcoming film 120 Bahadur. The court questioned the petitioners' sensitivity over the name while the film has received official clearance.

Fatima speaks hard truths on battling epilepsy, bulimia and years she lost to them Fatima Sana Shaikh opened up about her ongoing struggles with epilepsy and an eating disorder. She said these challenges began after her physical transformation for her debut film 'Dangal'.

Sai Pallavi posts heartfelt photos a month after Kalaimamani honour Sai Pallavi shared her experience of being honoured with the Kalaimamani award. The award was presented to her by Chief Minister of Tamil Nadu MK Stalin. She expressed her gratitude publicly and marked the occasion with her grandparents.

After Sinners, Ryan Coogler confirms his next film is Black Panther 3 Ryan Coogler has officially confirmed that 'Black Panther 3' is in the works. The filmmaker revealed that the movie will be his next project and hinted that Hollywood icon Denzel Washington may join the cast.

Bigg Boss 19: Abhishek, Mridul, Awez recreate memes; Nagma jokes about secret room Former 'Bigg Boss 19' contestants Abhishek Bajaj, Mridul Tiwari, Awez Darbar, and Nagma Mirajkar recently reunited for a fun reel. They recreated viral lines from their stint on the show and addressed the show's 'secret room' twist.

Bison on OTT: When and where to watch Dhruv Vikram's sports drama After a successful theatrical run, Mari Selvaraj's sports drama 'Bison Kaalamadan' prepares to reach a wider audience with its upcoming Netflix release, available in Tamil, Telugu, Malayalam, Kannada, and Hindi.

Shatrughan Sinha and wife check on Dharmendra's recovery, visit Hema Malini Actor Shatrughan Sinha and his wife Poonam recently visited Hema Malini to convey their best wishes for Dharmendra's speedy recovery. The veteran star was discharged from the hospital last week and is now recuperating at home.

Nick Jonas praises Priyanka Chopra's 'Desi Girl' look during Varanasi event Nick Jonas shared his appreciation for Priyanka Chopra's appearance at the title launch of her upcoming film 'Varanasi'. He posted supportive messages on social media and called her a desi girl.

Chiranjeevi, Nagarjuna thank Police Commissioner for iBomma piracy crackdown Tollywood actors Chiranjeevi and Nagarjuna met Hyderabad Police Commissioner VC Sajjanar to appreciate the department's swift action in arresting iBomma owner Immadhi Ravi, marking a significant breakthrough in the state's fight against digital movie piracy.

Nandamuri Balakrishna's Akhanda 2 to release in 3D, makers unveil new visuals Nandamuri Balakrishna's much-awaited sequel 'Akhanda 2' just levelled up. At a special event in Hyderabad, the makers announced that the film will release in all premium formats, including 3D.

Ram Pothineni's Andhra King Taluka release preponed, new date out The makers of 'Andhra King Taluka' have rescheduled the release, announcing that the Ram Pothineni starrer will now hit theatres worldwide on November 27, a day ahead of its original date.

The other Martin Scorsese: As the maestro turns 83, we look at his romantic films On Martin Scorsese's 83rd birthday, revisiting his rare romantic films — 'Alice Doesn't Live Here Anymore' and 'The Age of Innocence'— where the king of dark noir crafts love stories of fierce women claiming agency, gentle men baring souls, and vulnerabilities that transcend the grit he usually mines.

How Pokemon evolved from childhood nostalgia to global phenomenon In this week's Animania, we discover how 'Pokemon' evolved from a '90s gaming craze into a timeless global phenomenon that continues to capture hearts across generations.

Sanchith's debut 'Mango Pachcha' locks release date, confirms Kichcha Sudeep Sanchith Sanjeev, nephew of Kichcha Sudeep, to debut in Kannada cinema with crime thriller 'Mango Pachcha', directed by Vivek and slated for release during Sankranti festival in 2026.

Actor Meera Vasudevan ends third marriage: In most peaceful phase of life Malayalam actor Meera Vasudevan has officially announced her separation from cinematographer Vipin Puthiyankam. She revealed that she has been single since August 2025.

Deepika says she's rejected big cheques: They offer money and think it's enough Deepika Padukone opened up about why she has turned down massive paycheques for authenticity and meaningful storytelling. She also discussed choosing roles that feel true, embracing her identity as a 'global Indian'.

Dhurandhar: Akshaye Khanna's bloodied first look as Apex Predator is out Akshaye Khanna's first look from 'Dhurandhar' was unveiled ahead of the trailer launch. The film promises intense action and stars Ranveer Singh, releasing on December 5.

general news.headline: What India said after Bangladesh demanded Sheikh Hasina's returnUnder the existing extradition treaty signed between the two countries in 2013, a request to extradite a leader in exile may be turned down if it is deemed "politically motivated" - a phrase Hasina has repeatedly used since she fled the country last year.

Dr Umar was a shoe bomber, 'mother of Satan' explosive detected in i20: SourcesAccording to sources, fresh forensic and material evidence recovered from the blast site has shifted the focus sharply onto a shoe found inside Umar's i20 car.

45 Umrah pilgrims from Telangana killed in Saudi Arabia bus–tanker collisionAt least 45 Indian Umrah pilgrims from Hyderabad died after their bus collided with a tanker in Saudi Arabia. Telangana officials contacted MEA for details. MP Asaduddin Owaisi sought swift updates and assistance.

Sheikh Hasina gets death penalty, but she is in India: What happens now?Bangladesh has sentenced Sheikh Hasina to death, but she remains in India, beyond the tribunal's reach, prompting Dhaka to demand her extradition. For now, Hasina's fate rests entirely with New Delhi's next move.

Deepinder Goyal invokes bats to explain ageing. Bats and science disagreeGoyal argued that because bats sleep in an inverted, upside-down posture, they escape the wear and tear of gravity and thus live longer lives.

RJD's Tejashwi Yadav elected as Leader of Opposition in Bihar Legislative AssemblyTo be recognised as the Leader of the Opposition in any assembly, a party must secure at least 10 per cent of the total strength of the House, which in this case is 25 (10% of 243). Incidentally, the RJD secured 25 seats in the recently concluded Assembly elections.

Sheikh Hasina given death penalty on marriage anniversary. Was Nov 17 handpicked?Social media users in Bangladesh are abuzz with speculation after the International Crimes Tribunal rescheduled its verdict from November 14 to November 17. The latter is Sheikh Hasina's wedding anniversary. Hasina was married to nuclear scientist MA Wazed Miah on this day in 1967. The change of date on social media has fuelled claims that the date for the verdict was deliberately chosen to add a symbolic sting to the ousted PM's death sentence.

Fake Nandini ghee racket busted in Bengaluru; dip in orders exposed accusedKarnataka Milk Federation officials busted a fake ghee racket run by an authorised distributor in Bengaluru. The distributor allegedly diluted genuine Nandini ghee with palm oil and sold it to parlours.

Sholay's original ending: The climax India never saw, and reason it was scrappedAs 'Sholay' returns to theatres in a restored 4K version, audiences will finally see the film's original ending that never saw the light of the day. Here's what was in the climax and why it was scrapped.

Cognizant to monitor employees, laptops will be termed idle post 5 mins breakCognizant is reportedly cracking down on its employees with stricter monitoring systems. Now, employees may be marked 'idle' in case of no activity on their laptops for 5 minutes. The company will use a tool called ProHance to put this into effect in a gradual rollout.

Bengaluru woman loses Rs 32 crore in digital arrest, held on video call for monthsThe fraudsters posing as CBI officers kept her under constant Skype surveillance, coerced her into making 187 bank transfers.

Mandatory duty for India: Bangladesh demands Sheikh Hasina's immediate extraditionDhaka has urged New Delhi to immediately extradite former Bangladeshi Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina and her ex-interior minister, Asaduzzaman Khan Kamal, after both were convicted and sentenced to death for their role in a crackdown on a student uprising last year.

The Mahabharata Continues: The Story of India's Eternal Political Succession WarsA familiar drama is playing out in yet another Indian political dynasty. As the Lalu Prasad Yadav family implodes, we revisit the history of succession battles that have shaped Indian history and politics.

I am ready to die: Yuvraj's father Yograj Singh reveals battle with lonelinessFormer India cricketer Yuvraj Singh's father, Yograj Singh, has opened up about his loneliness and strained family ties. Despite his personal setbacks, the former all-rounder continues to stay connected to the game, working actively as a coach in Punjab.

Transcends boundaries: Maithili Thakur's Tamil song cover wins Annamalai's praiseMaithili Thakur shared a video singing a Tamil song, prompting praise for her diction and cross-cultural ease. BJP leader Annamalai lauded her language respect. Users said her singing bridged the North–South divide.

Deepika says she's rejected big cheques: They offer money and think it's enoughDeepika Padukone opened up about why she has turned down massive paycheques for authenticity and meaningful storytelling. She also discussed choosing roles that feel true, embracing her identity as a 'global Indian'.
Japan envoy tries Hyderabadi biryani in Telangana. His verdict is viralJapan's envoy to India tasted Hyderabadi biryani on a trip to Telangana and posted his review in a now-viral post on X.

Fear behind the turn: How Gautam Gambhir's pitch policy amplifies India's weaknessIndia's historic home Test dominance is unravelling. A steep batting slump against spin and risky pitch tactics under Gautam Gambhir have exposed vulnerabilities, culminating in crushing defeats like the 2024 New Zealand series. Yet, the coach refuses to learn from mistakes.

Prashant Kishor's Jan Suraaj isn't dead, it's born really now. Here's whyPrashant Kishor's Jan Suraaj has drawn a blank in the Bihar Assembly polls, but those writing its political obituary should stop right away. The debutant's 3.4% vote share, which is more than that of the Left parties and the AIMIM combined, is a significant indicator of the traction it has. Though it lost deposits in most seats, it also has third-place finishes in over 54%of the seats contested.

Pak rapper Talha Anjum waves Indian flag, tells critics he'll do it againPakistani rapper Talha Anjum has ignited a controversy after draping an Indian flag around his shoulders during his Kathmandu concert. His waving the tricolour and draping it were seen as provocative by many. He was singing his diss track Kaun Talha amid aimed at Indian Gully Gang rapper Naezy when an Indian flag was thrown at him. Anjum caught the flag midair and waved it.

As mahila shakti powers NDA win, a beti and behen's anguish haunts RJDIn the week women rewrote Bihar's political map, the RJD was forced to confront a crisis written by its own daughters, a contradiction far more damaging than its electoral defeat.

Why young Indians living alone are learning family recipesHave you ever wondered why you suddenly feel like picking up a pan and cooking a wholesome meal at home instead of opening a ready-to-eat pack or ordering in? Something has definitely changed, hasn't it?

Kadambini Ganguly breaks barriers as India's first woman surgeonShe didn't just enter the OT; she rewrote the rules. Kadambini Ganguly's trailblazing journey as India's first woman surgeon breaks barriers in the 1880s Calcutta.

Tribunal rigged, ruling biased: Sheikh Hasina's first reaction to death sentence Live Updates Speaking to India Today TV from New Delhi, where she has lived in exile since her ouster on 5 August 2024, Sheikh Hasina accused the interim government led by Muhammad Yunus of orchestrating a "vengeful prosecution" aimed at removing her permanently from Bangladesh's political landscape.

Pawan Kalyan calls iBomma founder's arrest a welcome move, praises Hyderabad PoliceAndhra Pradesh Deputy CM Pawan Kalyan joined senior Tollywood stars in praising the Hyderabad Police for arresting iBomma founder Immadhi Ravi, calling it a key breakthrough in the fight against movie piracy.

After The Girlfriend, Dheekshith Shetty leads heist film Bank of BhagyalakshmiDheekshith Shetty returns to Kannada cinema with the comedy heist film 'Bank of Bhagyalakshmi'. The trailer promises a unique blend of humour and thrills, releasing in theatres on November 21.

sports.headline: Who is Laila Hasanovic? Jannik Sinner celebrates ATP Finals win with girlfriend Jannik Sinner celebrated his ATP Finals triumph by sharing a warm moment with girlfriend Laila Hasanovic after defeating Carlos Alcaraz in straight sets. Despite the win, Alcaraz still finished as year-end World No. 1.

Ashes: Big boost for Australia as fit-again Pat Cummins bowls full tilt in Perth Pat Cummins returned to full-intensity bowling, giving Australia a boost ahead of the Ashes, even though he remained ruled out of the first Test. In his absence, Brendan Doggett is set for a historic debut.

Shubman Gill to travel to Guwahati, though 2nd Test participation remains in doubt India captain Shubman Gill has been discharged from hospital after a neck injury. His participation in the second Test remains uncertain, but he will travel with the team to Guwahati.

Fear under Gautam Gambhir: Ex-player makes big claim after Kolkata Test shocker India vs South Africa: Former batter Mohammad Kaif said batters in the current Test team are playing with fear for their places and a lot of insecurity. He alleged that the Gautam Gambhir-led team management has not been backing the batters enough.

India should not have all-format captain, split captaincy is smart move: Mukund Former India opener Abhinav Mukund believes India should not have an all-format captain and that split captaincy is the right move for Indian cricket.

East Bengal begin AFC Women's Champions League with strong 3–1 win vs Bam Khatoon FC East Bengal opened their AFC Women's Champions League campaign with a solid 3–1 win over Bam Khatoon FC. The result gives them an early boost ahead of their next clash against defending champions Wuhan Jiangda.

Who is Brendan Doggett? The Indigenous man set for Australia Test debut in Ashes Brendan Doggett is set to become Australia's 472nd Test cricketer and only the third Indigenous man to play Test cricket for the country, marking a historic moment as he closes in on his Ashes debut.

Alcaraz and Sinner now tied at 1,651 points each after Nitto ATP Finals showdown Jannik Sinner's ATP Finals win over Carlos Alcaraz confirmed a rare statistical deadlock in their rivalry. Both players have now won exactly 1,651 of the 3,302 points played between them.

Joe Root most prized wicket: Boland downplays star's poor record in Australia Ashes: Australia's Scott Boland said Joe Root remains the most sought-after wicket in the England batting order, even though the former English captain is still waiting for his first Ashes hundred in Australia.

Watch: Karma hits Dominik Szoboszlai hard as Hungary knocked out by Ireland Dominik Szoboszlai's mocking celebration backfired as Ireland stunned Hungary to secure a spot in the play-offs for the World Cup qualifiers. The loss against the Irish side meant that Hungary were knocked out in the group stages.

Fear behind the turn: How Gautam Gambhir's pitch policy amplifies India's weakness India's historic home Test dominance is unravelling. A steep batting slump against spin and risky pitch tactics under Gautam Gambhir have exposed vulnerabilities, culminating in crushing defeats like the 2024 New Zealand series. Yet, the coach refuses to learn from mistakes.

Who is Brendan Doggett? The Indigenous man set for Australia Test debut in Ashes Brendan Doggett is set to become Australia's 472nd Test cricketer and only the third Indigenous man to play Test cricket for the country, marking a historic moment as he closes in on his Ashes debut.

Alcaraz and Sinner now tied at 1,651 points each after Nitto ATP Finals showdown Jannik Sinner's ATP Finals win over Carlos Alcaraz confirmed a rare statistical deadlock in their rivalry. Both players have now won exactly 1,651 of the 3,302 points played between them.

Joe Root most prized wicket: Boland downplays star's poor record in Australia Ashes: Australia's Scott Boland said Joe Root remains the most sought-after wicket in the England batting order, even though the former English captain is still waiting for his first Ashes hundred in Australia.

Watch: Karma hits Dominik Szoboszlai hard as Hungary knocked out by Ireland Dominik Szoboszlai's mocking celebration backfired as Ireland stunned Hungary to secure a spot in the play-offs for the World Cup qualifiers. The loss against the Irish side meant that Hungary were knocked out in the group stages.

Fear behind the turn: How Gautam Gambhir's pitch policy amplifies India's weakness India's historic home Test dominance is unravelling. A steep batting slump against spin and risky pitch tactics under Gautam Gambhir have exposed vulnerabilities, culminating in crushing defeats like the 2024 New Zealand series. Yet, the coach refuses to learn from mistakes.

IPL tougher than internationals? KL Rahul says captains are always questionedOpening up about the pressures of IPL leadership, KL Rahul said the demands of franchise cricket can be more draining than international duties, pointing to ownership-level scrutiny, relentless expectations and rapid team changes as major challenges modern players must navigate.

PCB chief Mohsin Naqvi overjoyed as Pakistan stun India in Rising Stars Asia CupMohsin Naqvi was thrilled with Pakistan Shaheens' comprehensive win over India in the Rising Stars Asia Cup 2025. The PCB chairman hailed the win and praised the performance from the team.

Pakistan board hands Sarfaraz Ahmed full responsibility of Shaheens, U19 setupThe Pakistan Cricket Board has handed former captain Sarfaraz Ahmed full responsibility for overseeing the Pakistan Shaheens and Under-19 teams, marking a significant restructuring step as the board looks to strengthen its pathway programmes.

No.3 move could affect Washington Sundar's bowling in long run: Dinesh KarthikDinesh Karthik believes that the move to bat at No. 3 could have a long-term impact on Washington Sundar's bowling. Sundar batted for the first time at No.3 during the Kolkata Test against South Africa.

Sam Konstas named in Australian Prime Minister's XI for Ashes warm-up vs EnglandYoung opener Sam Konstas, who was dropped from Australia's Ashes squad, has been named in the Australian Prime Minister's XI for the tour game against England, starting on November 29 in Canberra.

I am ready to die: Yuvraj's father Yograj Singh reveals battle with lonelinessFormer India cricketer Yuvraj Singh's father, Yograj Singh, has opened up about his loneliness and strained family ties. Despite his personal setbacks, the former all-rounder continues to stay connected to the game, working actively as a coach in Punjab.

Rajasthan confirm Rahul Dravid replacement, Sangakkara to double as head coachIPL 2026: Rajasthan Royals announced Kumar Sangakkara, their Director of Cricket, will double as head coach for the upcoming season. He will replace Rahul Dravid, who left after working with them for a season.

Masters of spin no more: Irfan Pathan feels Indian batters' skill on declineIrfan Pathan feels that the Indian batters are no longer the masters of playing spin as they lost the Kolkata Test to South Africa. Simon Harmer spun a web around the Indian batters as they crumbled and failed to chase 124 in the second innings.

Sam Konstas named in Australian Prime Minister's XI for Ashes warm-up vs EnglandYoung opener Sam Konstas, who was dropped from Australia's Ashes squad, has been named in the Australian Prime Minister's XI for the tour game against England, starting on November 29 in Canberra.

I am ready to die: Yuvraj's father Yograj Singh reveals battle with lonelinessFormer India cricketer Yuvraj Singh's father, Yograj Singh, has opened up about his loneliness and strained family ties. Despite his personal setbacks, the former all-rounder continues to stay connected to the game, working actively as a coach in Punjab.

Rajasthan confirm Rahul Dravid replacement, Sangakkara to double as head coachIPL 2026: Rajasthan Royals announced Kumar Sangakkara, their Director of Cricket, will double as head coach for the upcoming season. He will replace Rahul Dravid, who left after working with them for a season.

Masters of spin no more: Irfan Pathan feels Indian batters' skill on declineIrfan Pathan feels that the Indian batters are no longer the masters of playing spin as they lost the Kolkata Test to South Africa. Simon Harmer spun a web around the Indian batters as they crumbled and failed to chase 124 in the second innings.

RIP Test Cricket: Harbhajan slams Kolkata pitch after India suffer shock loss to SAFormer India spinner Harbhajan Singh criticised the team management following India's defeat to South Africa in the opening Test at Eden Gardens, saying that the obsession with preparing rank turners is damaging both the spirit of Test cricket and the development of Indian players.

Jannik Sinner beats Carlos Alcaraz in straight sets to retain ATP Finals titleJannik Sinner successfully defended his ATP Finals title by beating world No.1 Carlos Alcaraz 7-6(4), 7-5 in Turin. Despite Alcaraz taking the No.1 ranking, Sinner capped an exceptional season with another major win on home soil.

Bring back Mohammed Shami: Ganguly tells Gautam Gambhir after Kolkata Test lossSourav Ganguly has advised Gautam Gambhir to recall Mohammed Shami back into the Test team after the loss to South Africa in Kolkata. Shami last played for India in 2023 during the WTC final.

Cristiano Ronaldo set for record sixth World Cup as Portugal thrash Armenia 9-1Portugal booked their place at the 2026 FIFA World Cup with a decisive 9-1 victory over Armenia, giving Cristiano Ronaldo the chance to feature in a record sixth World Cup. Hat-tricks from Bruno Fernandes and João Neves headlined the dominant display.

Sanju Samson: Relentless talent wrestling with expectations and the Kambli paradoxSanju Samson's T20I career remains a compelling saga of breathtaking promise and persistent struggle - a journey where repeated opportunities collide with inconsistency and inner battles, shaping what many see as cricket's own Vinod Kambli paradox.

Haaland-inspired Norway thump Italy 4-1 to end 28-year World Cup waitErling Haaland's two late goals propelled Norway to a 4–1 victory over Italy in Rome, confirming their qualification for the 2026 FIFA World Cup and ending a 28-year absence. Norway finished the group stage with a flawless record, while Italy faces another playoff challenge.

South Africa coach Conrad credits spin revolution for historic Test win in IndiaSouth Africa coach Shukri Conrad said he was delighted to see his spinners take charge in the first Test against India at the Eden Gardens. Conrad added that the performance showed his side is no longer defined solely as a "fast bowling country" and expressed hope that it will inspire more young slow bowlers back home.

Kris Srikkanth slams Gambhir's Kolkata pitch defence: I would have taken wickets hereFormer India selector Kris Srikkanth slammed Gautam Gambhir's assessment of the Kolkata pitch after India's loss to South Africa in the first Test in Kolkata. The Eden Gardens track came under the scanner after the match ended in just two and a half days.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
